summary: Project now includes ensuring production reliability of CoinGecko HTTP outcalls by preventing backend canister cycle exhaustion (auto top-ups/monitoring) in addition to live-mode go-live prep and in-app debug/testing.
architectural_notes: Frontend depends on a cached backend canister ID (e.g., in localStorage); actor creation can stall if the cached ID is missing/wiped and auto-discovery does not run.

Backend canister `itsron_crypto_backend` exposes `getLiveMarketData(symbol)` and will add a `debugFetchCoinGecko(symbol)` function that performs an HTTP outcall to the CoinGecko URL builder and returns the raw response for debugging.
Need an explicit, persistent environment/mode configuration (demo vs live) and a clear path to deploy/verify the live mode in the hosted Caffeine environment.

Caffeine environment has no terminal/dfx access for the user; CoinGecko raw-response validation must be done via an in-app UI/tester flow that calls canister methods and renders the returned raw response (and any surfaced debug info).
HTTPS outcalls to CoinGecko require cycles; backend must monitor cycle balance and maintain sufficient cycles (e.g., via auto top-ups) to avoid IC0504 rejections in production.

Add Crypto dialog should fetch the available coin/symbol list from the backend `validSymbols` map and provide a searchable Symbol Picker UI; selecting a symbol calls `addCryptoToWatchlist` and triggers an immediate UI refresh of watchlist/dashboard state.
known_issues: Clearing browser cache/cookies can wipe the cached backend canister ID, causing the app to remain stuck on “Connecting to backend” (actor never begins fetching; stage remains idle) even when Internet Identity is authenticated.
Coverage report indicates `debugFetchCoinGecko` has not been added to `backend/main.mo` yet despite a deployment; needs implementation + redeploy + test.
Backend canister ran out of cycles, causing IC0504 rejection on CoinGecko HTTPS outcalls and breaking live market data for all symbols until cycles are replenished.
Watchlist price ticks section is still hard-coded to always show “Coming Soon” and is not wired to live market data (no `useGetLiveMarketData()` per symbol / no watchlist-to-symbol binding).

existing_features.title: Add a developer-facing documentation file that includes the exact deploy and test commands to validate raw CoinGecko responses via `dfx`, using the canister name `itsron_crypto_backend` and covering BTC, ETH, and XRP.

Switch the frontend live market data flow from disabled/demo stubs to real backend calls: implement `useGetLiveMarketData(symbol)` in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` to call the backend actor’s `getLiveMarketData(symbol)` and enable the query when an actor is available.

Remove demo-mode UI and mock values from the dashboard crypto cards: update `frontend/src/components/CryptoCard.tsx` to render the live backend response (price/change/market cap as available) and remove all “Demo Mode” alerts and “Demo data (backend pending)” copy for these cards.

Update Backend Tester commands so market-data-related commands run in live mode against the backend actor instead of returning simulated/demo responses (at minimum: the `getLiveMarketData` command in `frontend/src/utils/backendTesterCommands.ts`).

Replace demo-mode messaging in watchlist-related UI components with production-safe “Coming soon” messaging (since watchlist backend endpoints are not implemented): update `frontend/src/components/WatchlistManager.tsx` and `frontend/src/components/WatchlistPriceTicks.tsx` to remove “Demo Mode” labeling while keeping a clear, non-misleading status message in English.

Remove demo-only labeling inside the analysis/forecast UI so the app reads as production-ready: update `frontend/src/components/ForecastChart.tsx` to eliminate “Demo Data / demonstration data / Backend pending” copy and replace it with neutral, accurate wording (e.g., “Sample data” or “Local simulation”) until a real historical-data backend exists.

Expose the CoinGecko debug calls inside the live app UI by adding three Backend Tester commands for `debugFetchCoinGecko` (BTC, ETH, XRP) and rendering their full, copy/paste-friendly output in the tester panel.

Add an in-app Cycle Status view in the Backend Tester UI by introducing one or more tester commands (in `frontend/src/utils/backendTesterCommands.ts`) that call the new backend cycle diagnostics methods and render the results in a copy/paste-friendly format in the existing `SimulatedBashPanel`.

Improve user-facing error handling on the Dashboard crypto cards so cycle-exhaustion failures are understandable: when the live market data request fails with an IC rejection containing ‘out of cycles’ / IC0504, show a concise English message indicating the backend is out of cycles and live data is temporarily unavailable until cycles are topped up.

Expose the new backend historical-data method through a React Query hook in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` and ensure it only runs when the backend actor is available and identity initialization has completed.

Update `frontend/src/components/ForecastChart.tsx` to use live historical price data from the backend instead of generating local sample history, and update all user-facing text to reflect live data (English).

Ensure the Crypto detail analysis dialog continues to work end-to-end using the updated ForecastChart, and verify the user flow from Dashboard -> CryptoCard -> View Analysis & Forecast renders live-data-backed analysis for supported symbols.

Replace the hard-coded “Coming Soon” placeholder in `frontend/src/components/WatchlistPriceTicks.tsx` with a live list UI that fetches and displays live market data ticks using the existing `useGetLiveMarketData(symbol)` React Query hook and the existing CoinGecko parsing/formatting utilities.

Wire `WatchlistPriceTicks` into the Dashboard so it receives a deterministic symbol list to display (until backend watchlist endpoints exist), and ensure the card header/subtitle remain accurate and non-misleading in English.

Fix the frontend backend-connection bootstrap flow so the app cannot remain indefinitely stuck on “Connecting to backend” after browser cache/cookies/storage are cleared and the cached backend canister ID is missing; the app must either (a) successfully re-discover/recreate the backend actor, or (b) surface a clear actionable error state with recovery actions.

Harden the actor initialization hook so it reliably reports errors when actor creation fails (including missing canister ID / misconfiguration) instead of silently staying in an idle/loading state, and ensure the error is propagated to the existing connection UI (ConnectionBootstrapper / ConnectionDetails).

Improve Watchlist live price tick row error messaging for cycle-exhaustion failures so it is user-understandable and consistent with the dashboard’s cycle error handling: when the live market data request fails with an IC rejection containing 'out of cycles' / IC0504 (or equivalent), show a concise English message indicating the backend is out of cycles and live data is temporarily unavailable until cycles are topped up.

Replace the stubbed React Query hooks in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` with live implementations that call the backend for (1) fetching valid symbols, (2) fetching the caller’s watchlist, and (3) adding a symbol to the watchlist, and ensure they only run when the backend actor is available and Internet Identity initialization has completed.

Create a new reusable `SymbolPicker` React component that renders a search input at the top and a scrollable list of symbols below; the list must be filtered using a standard React in-memory filter so that as the user types, the list narrows to matching symbols.

Update `frontend/src/components/AddCryptoDialog.tsx` to remove the current placeholder “Feature Not Available” demo message and replace it with the live Symbol Picker UI fed by the backend `validSymbols` data.

Update the dashboard to reflect the user’s watchlist immediately after adding a coin by sourcing live tick symbols from the backend watchlist (using the new `useGetWatchlist` hook) instead of a fixed hard-coded symbol list.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add a Motoko debug endpoint (debugFetchCoinGecko) to log/return raw CoinGecko HTTP response for a given crypto symbol and use it to validate getLiveMarketData for BTC/ETH/XRP via dfx calls.

Add a public shared Motoko debug endpoint `debugFetchCoinGecko(symbol : CryptoSymbol) : async Text` in `backend/main.mo` that builds the CoinGecko URL for the given symbol, performs the HTTP GET outcall, prints debug logs (URL + raw response), and returns the raw response body as `Text`, matching the user-provided function behavior.

Ensure the backend canister exposes `getLiveMarketData(symbol : CryptoSymbol)` callable via `dfx canister call itsron_crypto_backend getLiveMarketData '("BTC")'` / `("ETH")` / `("XRP")`, and that it uses the same CoinGecko URL-building logic as `debugFetchCoinGecko` so live-data failures can be debugged consistently.

Preserve the existing user-profile and authorization behavior currently implemented in `backend/main.mo` (profile getters/setter and access control mixin) while adding the new crypto debug and live-market-data functions.

Implement `debugFetchCoinGecko(symbol : CryptoSymbol) : async Text` in `backend/main.mo` exactly matching the user-provided behavior: it must switch on `buildCoinGeckoUrl(symbol)`, print the URL being fetched, perform `OutCall.httpGetRequest(url, [], transform)`, print the raw response, and return the raw response; when the URL cannot be built, it must return the error text `"❌ Error: Could not build URL for symbol: " # symbol`.

Redeploy the backend canister after implementing `debugFetchCoinGecko`, and verify it works by calling it for supported symbols (at minimum: BTC, ETH, XRP) and confirming the call returns the raw CoinGecko HTTP response as `Text`.

Ensure the backend canister exposes an admin-only `debugFetchCoinGecko(symbol : CryptoSymbol) : async Text` method that returns the raw CoinGecko HTTP response body as `Text` for supported symbols (BTC, ETH, XRP) and returns the exact error text `"❌ Error: Could not build URL for symbol: " # symbol` when the URL cannot be built.

Refactor `getLiveMarketData(symbol : CryptoSymbol)` to use the same CoinGecko URL-building logic as `debugFetchCoinGecko` (i.e., `buildCoinGeckoUrl(symbol)`) so both methods are consistent for BTC/ETH/XRP and unsupported symbol handling is deterministic.
Disable/demo-mode removal and switch the app to live/production mode (ensure real backend connectivity and live market data usage instead of demo behavior), then redeploy and validate end-to-end.

Update the backend so `getLiveMarketData(symbol : CryptoSymbol)` uses the same CoinGecko URL-building logic as `buildCoinGeckoUrl(symbol)` (the same logic used by `debugFetchCoinGecko`) and returns a deterministic, user-facing error message when the symbol is unsupported.

Add an in-app (live app UI) tester panel/buttons to run `debugFetchCoinGecko("BTC")`, `("ETH")`, and `("XRP")` and display the full results to the user (including the equivalent command string shown, any available debug/log text, and the raw JSON response body in quotes) since the user has no terminal/dfx access.

Add a new admin-only backend method `debugFetchCoinGecko(symbol : CryptoSymbol) : async Text` in `backend/main.mo` that fetches the raw CoinGecko HTTP response for the given symbol and returns a single Text payload suitable for copy/paste debugging in the live app.

Keep `getLiveMarketData(symbol : CryptoSymbol)` behavior intact, but ensure it continues to use the existing `buildCoinGeckoUrl(symbol)` mapping so both `getLiveMarketData` and `debugFetchCoinGecko` are consistent for BTC/ETH/XRP and unsupported symbols remain deterministic.
Prevent CoinGecko HTTP outcalls from failing due to cycle exhaustion by adding backend cycle-balance checks and an automatic top-up strategy (so the canister does not reach 0 cycles during outcalls).
Add an in-app UI/tester display for backend canister cycle status (e.g., remaining cycles / last top-up) so cycle-related failures can be diagnosed without terminal/dfx access.

Add backend cycle-safety checks for all CoinGecko HTTPS outcalls so the canister does not reach 0 cycles during `getLiveMarketData(symbol)` / `debugFetchCoinGecko(symbol)` execution. When the cycle balance is below a defined safety threshold, the backend must not attempt the outcall and must return a deterministic, user-facing English error message that clearly indicates the canister is low/out of cycles (and that an admin must top up cycles).

Expose backend cycle diagnostics via new backend methods that the frontend can call without terminal/dfx access: a query method to return current canister cycle balance, plus a structured status method (e.g., balance + configured threshold + a human-readable status string) suitable for display in the in-app tester.

Switch the Analysis/Forecast tab from sample/local simulation data to live backend-powered data (e.g., real historical/analysis inputs), wiring the Analysis UI to fetch and render real data instead of placeholders.

Add a new backend method that fetches historical price data from CoinGecko for a given crypto symbol so the Analysis/Forecast UI can use live historical inputs instead of locally generated sample data.

Fix Watchlist Live Price Ticks UI by replacing the hard-coded “Coming Soon” block in `WatchlistPriceTicks` with real rendering: load watchlist symbols from backend (if available) and/or use existing watchlist state, run `useGetLiveMarketData()` per symbol, and display live price tick updates instead of the placeholder.

Replace the 'Add Crypto' demo message with a live, searchable React 'Symbol Picker' list sourced from the backend `validSymbols` map; on selection call `addCryptoToWatchlist` and immediately update/refresh the dashboard.

Expose the backend coin directory used by the frontend by implementing a `validSymbols` map in `backend/main.mo` and a user-accessible method to read it (e.g., `getValidSymbols()`), so the frontend can fetch the list directly from the backend rather than using hard-coded/demo data.

Implement backend watchlist persistence and mutations in `backend/main.mo` by adding a per-user watchlist store and an authenticated backend method `addCryptoToWatchlist(symbol : CryptoSymbol)` that adds a selected symbol to the caller’s watchlist.

Implement a backend watchlist read endpoint in `backend/main.mo` (e.g., `getWatchlist() : async [CryptoSymbol]`) so the frontend can render the user’s current selections and refresh the dashboard after mutations.
